Content.Question:
motorcycle
1894 Unknown, Atlanta (Georgia) Constit. “Some inventive genius with more activity in his brain than in his legs, has devised a cycle which appears to meet the utmost requirements of pure laziness. It is called the motor cycle and the propelling power is produced by coal oil.”

1896 Unknown, Daily News “This Exhibition..will comprise motor-cycles and carriages.”

1902 Unknown, Motor Cycling “In a year or two motor cycles will be as plentiful as the ordinary cycle is to-day.”

1925 E. von Arnim, Love “You know how strongly I feel about motorcycles, and the type of scallywag youth who uses them.”

1934 T. S. Eliot, Rock “Every son would have his motor cycle.”

1955 W. Gaddis, Recognitions “All you got to do is get them dumb cops on their motorcycles, and string a good piece of piano wire across the road.”

1972 R. Adams, Watership Down “Few places are far from human noise—cars, buses, motor-cycles, tractors, lorries.”

2001 Unknown, St. Petersburg (Florida) Times “Next weekend in Pinellas Park will be a motorhead's dream come true as motorcycles and NASCAR race cars highlight other city festivities.”
Content.Answer:
motorcycle - A two-wheeled motor-driven road vehicle, resembling a bicycle but powered by an internal combustion engine; (now) spec. one with an engine capacity, top speed, or weight greater than that of a moped.
This is the main current sense
Content.SuperMemoReference: <H5 dir=ltr align=left><Font size="1" style="color: transparent"> SuperMemo Reference:</font><br><FONT class=reference>Title:"My Test Quote" <br>Source: Oxford English Dictionary

Content.Question:
motorcycle
1938 P. Oliver, Blues Trad. “He's a dirty motor-cycle.”

1973 Unknown, Oui “She's a bad motorcycle.”

1985 J. T. Heywood, Taxi Dancer “We got us a bad motor-cycle this mornin', gents.”
Content.Answer: motorcycle - U.S. slang (euphemistic). = motherfucker, n. 1. Usually modified by bad. Cf. also motor scooter, n. 3.
Content.SuperMemoReference: <H5 dir=ltr align=left><Font size="1" style="color: transparent"> SuperMemo Reference:</font><br><FONT class=reference>Title:"My Test Quote" <br>Source: Oxford English Dictionary
